thread.title: NFL extends deal to play games at Wembley through 2020
thread.title_full: NFL extends deal to play games at Wembley through 2020

title: NFL extends deal to play games at Wembley through 2020
text:
Updated: 11:06 a.m. Thursday, Oct. 22, 2015 | Posted: 11:06 a.m. Thursday, Oct. 22, 2015 NFL extends deal to play games at Wembley through 2020 Related View Larger Buffalo Bills defensive tackle Marcell Dareus, center, cornerback Ron Brooks, left, and defensive tackle Stefan Charles, right, walk off the field at the end of an NFL training session at the Grove Hotel in Chandler's Cross, England, Thursday, Oct. 22, 2015. The Buffalo Bills play the Jacksonville Jaguars at Wembley stadium in London on Sunday in a regular season NFL game. (AP Photo/Matt Dunham) View Larger Buffalo Bills quarterback EJ Manuel smiles during a press conference after an NFL training session at the Grove Hotel in Chandler's Cross, England, Thursday, Oct. 22, 2015. The Buffalo Bills play the Jacksonville Jaguars at Wembley stadium in London on Sunday in a regular season NFL game. (AP Photo/Matt Dunham) Sponsored Links The Associated Press LONDON â€” 
The NFL has extended its agreement with Wembley Stadium for another five years, meaning it will play at least two regular-season games a year at the London venue through 2020. 
The Jacksonville Jaguars will continue to play at Wembley every year throughout the agreement. 
The NFL also has an option to extend the Wembley deal for an extra five years beyond 2020. 
The league has played regular-season games at Wembley every year since 2007, and is playing three games in London this year for the second straight season. 
The deal was announced ahead of Sunday's game between the Jaguars and Buffalo Bills. 
The Jaguars are in the third year of a four-year deal to play one game in London per year. Copyright The Associated Press Sign up for our WFTV Morning News Headlines Newsletter Sign Up
